PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer package

Submodules

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel module

class PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel.ExcelWriter(engine: str = '', fmt: str = 'xlsx')

Bases: object

A class for writing Excel files, supporting multiple engines and formats.

Parameters:

  • engine – The name of the engine to use for writing. If not specified, it is auto-detected based on the file format.

  • fmt – The format of the file (e.g., ‘xls’, ‘xlsx’). Default to ‘xlsx’.

add_sheet(s: Sheet, index: int = -1)

Adds a sheet to the Excel file at the specified index.

Parameters:

  • s (Sheet) – The sheet to add.

  • index (int) – The index at which to insert the sheet. Defaults to -1, which appends the sheet.

classmethod from_reader(reader: ExcelReader, use_engine: str = '', fmt: str = 'xlsx')

Create a copy from the ExcelReader for writing.

Parameters:

  • reader (ExcelReader) – The ExcelReader to copy from.

  • use_engine (str) – The engine to use for writing.

  • fmt (str) – The file format to use for writing.

Returns:

A new ExcelWriter instance.

Return type:

ExcelWriter

get_sheet(name_or_idx: int | str)

Retrieves a sheet by its name or index.

Parameters:

name_or_idx (Union[int, str]) – The name or index of the sheet.

Returns:

The requested sheet.

Return type:

Sheet

Raises:

LookupError – If the sheet cannot be found.

save(saver: None | str | BytesIO = None)

Saves the Excel file to the specified location or stream.

Parameters:

saver (Union[None, str, io.BytesIO]) – The file path or stream to save to. If None, the file will be saved to memory.

Returns:

If param ‘saver’ is None, return the content as bytes. Otherwise, return None.

property sheet_names

Returns a list of the names of all sheets.

Returns:

A list of sheet names.

Return type:

list[str]

property sheets

Returns a copy of the list of sheets.

Returns:

A list of sheets.

Return type:

list[Sheet]

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel.add_writer(engine: Type[BaseWriter])

Registers a new writer engine.

Parameters:

engine – The engine class to be registered, which must be a subclass of WriteBook.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel.auto_engine(fmt: str)

Determines the appropriate engine to use based on the file format.

Parameters:

fmt – The format of the file (e.g., ‘xls’, ‘xlsx’).

Returns:

The name of the engine to use (‘xlwt’ for ‘xls’ files, ‘xlsxwriter’ for ‘xlsx’ files).

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel.install_builtin_writers()

Registers all built-in writer engines found in the Readers module. This function searches for subclasses of WriteBook in the Readers module

and registers them using their __engine__ attribute.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Writer.Excel.remove_writer(name: str)

Removes a writer engine from the registry by name.

Parameters:

name – The name of the engine to be removed.
